newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Petrogal says Angolan well tests positiv.
newsitem.headline: Petrogal says Angolan well tests positiv.

text.p: Portuguese state oil firm Petrogal-Petroleos de Portugal said that a consortium seeking oil in offshore well 14-2X in Bloc 14 off northern Angola had obtained "positive results."
A statement said initial results indicated a combined volume of about 7,500 barrels of oil per day (bpd).

"The companies associated with Bloc 14, Cabinda Gulf Oil Company (Cabgoc), Sonangol, Agip Angola Ltd, Total Angola and Petrogal, said they had obtained positive results in 14-2X well on Bloc 14 in deep waters off Angola," the statement said.
"This well is located 16 kilometres (10 miles) from the Cabinda concession, where Cabgoc is the operator," it said.
Petrogal spokesman Antonio Mocho told Reuters that Petrogal had a nine percent stake in Bloc 14.
